intro: Hemibaccharis mucronata, commonly known as the Brazilian broom or mucronata broom, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
